descriptionHtml:
Video by steveowashere17    [url=https://youtu.be/o-D0ckdz91Y]https://youtu.be/o-D0ckdz91Y[/url][u]

Parallax Tutorial: [/u]

Shortcuts are from the german version of PS
strg = ctrl

A. Mesh part, tutorial over there:
Vivid Landscapes - Rocking Stones and Mountains Parallax by Aron - FILES - DL - Endorse
- Scroll down to the bottom and look into that 4 screenshots for editing meshes. Pretty easy stuff.
http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/38004/?tab=2&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmodfiles%2F%3Fid%3D38004&pUp=1
B. Get [b]Photoshop[/b], everybody has it. Get [b]Crazybump[/b], it's 30 days free or longer if you aren't dumb.
1. Crazybump: open the "normal" texture, xxx.dds for diffuse chose the left side preview
2. Go [b]Displacement[/b], recommended "enhance detail" 80 - 95, you see the difference ingame. save as xxx_p.dds Alt-Tab to
3. Photoshop: Open your new file xxx_disp.dds or whatever you named it. Make sure you have the window "actions", click actions, create new action.
4. Picture, Picture size 1024 or 512 (alt-strg-i) then picture-corrections-levels (strg-L), can't make much wrong from 100 to 155 or go wider if you feel like that(60-155)
5. gaussian blur(strg-F is repeat): strength 1-2 one or two times, dependant on detail needed and resolution.
6. Stop action, give it a shortcut like shift-F3
7. Save: (strg-s) as DXT 1
8. Now you got that action saved, next time hit shift-F3 and strg-S and your parallax texture is done for 95% of cases

Please tell me if I got some major translation stuff wrong, or how you would improve the tutorial.
Would be cool if someone does a video. You can have my small tut.


[youtube][/youtube]
author: Pfuscher aka Zerwas1
